author: {'steamid': '76561198210923575', 'num_games_owned': 233, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1010, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1010, 'last_played': 1531400470}
review: Expected a cute Yuri story with a bit of mystery, but got a heartwrenching drama about dealing with loss that totally destroyed me instead, and I loved every second of it!

author: {'steamid': '76561198029934580', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 2810, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2809, 'last_played': 1560824717}
review:
It's a very good yuri VN.

In many ways this is not the kind of VN I would normally rank highly, it is slow, and essentially not much happens at times, but still it drags me in, kind of like "One more turn" syndrome you'll see from Civ.

The characters are complleing, I want to see more, even if its just the simple Slice of life stuff, which incidentally is what comprises probably close to 80% of the VN.

The music is good too, although I heard it is freeware. Most of the backgrounds are also simple, or fudged photos. Their event CGs are simple yet charming.

Do wish they released an artbook though, and pity they probably cannot release a soundtrack OST.

author: {'steamid': '76561198287062183', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 357, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 266, 'last_played': 1529760286}
review:
Although this VN takes a lot of time describing the mundane everyday life of its characters, the mystery aspect does a good job of keeping the reader engaged until the end. Especially the unreliable narrator keeps you guessing on how much of what's happening is actually real.
This reads a lot like a proper novel and similarly one could probably write a pretty decent literary analysis of this story, since everything has it's place and plays into the central themes of the novel.
Recommended for everyone who can enjoy stories that go on their own pace.

author: {'steamid': '76561197997074607', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 920, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 920, 'last_played': 1529042180}
review:
SeaBed. A nice yuri story that isn't about the sex and actually has an interesting story. Interesting, yet confusing. This has a few pacing issues, as stated by others, and I won't lie, I kept falling asleep on some parts. To the point where I just plainfully stopped reading. But then I suddenly wanted to pick this up again and it got GOOD. That kept me going.

So definitely the first half of the game is pretty slow, you may want to fall asleep a few times, but trust me, and the other reviews: it DOES get good. Feels definitely do get played, and I love that.

The ending was pretty... confusing. To me, at least. Not that it was a bad ending, per say. I just couldn't wrap everything up, and that kind of sucks. Even with the TIPS (which is HIGHLY recommended you read after unlocking them for more understing and lore), I'm still somewhat at a lost, but I kind of get it.

I really loved the music, although I heard it's just "freeware" music. Regardless, they were well put for the situations that happened.

Overall, I'd give this a 7/10. Would give it an 8, if the story/ending in general was more clear.

author: {'steamid': '76561198136214992', 'num_games_owned': 350, 'num_reviews': 193, 'playtime_forever': 1930, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1930, 'last_played': 1526837125}
review:
Around 7/10 recommended. This is the sort of VNs that if you like it, it would be a very good experience; but if you don't like it, it's hard to finish the VN itself. The text are very good (almost like reading a real-world novel, which is actually not that usual in today's VNs), the music is really on-the-spot, and the CGs are pretty good and fit the story itself.

This VN also take some unusual themes: adult lesbian couple, mental illness, mystery and loss of long-term relationship. The text itself contains a lot of metaphors. And just by reading the text, I usually find myself in a slightly meditative state.

author: {'steamid': '76561197994048123', 'num_games_owned': 118, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 4332, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 3, 'playtime_at_review': 4311, 'last_played': 1711651684}
review: SeaBed its a VN off the curve, the slow pace, flashback, and how little by little the pieces of a giant and complex puzzle starts to gain it form. But, thats exactly why it is such a good VN when combined with an extremely rich, and quite dynamic text that moves on as you know more the story. plus, by making you think what might or might not happen its something that I love. Putting the reader out of its confort zone, and the need to think out the box, it is just right.

author: {'steamid': '76561197998887445', 'num_games_owned': 1095, 'num_reviews': 173, 'playtime_forever': 1470, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 756, 'last_played': 1561072468}
review:
This VN is an excellent change of page. It's slow, but feels like an actual novel. It's entirely lacking in the usual mystery-type plots involving murders or kidnappings or what-have-you, instead being based around mental health, what is real and what is not, and being able to understand what you're being told.

The story is very well written, with no typos that I spotted, and a delicately made world that feels wonderfully put together without bragging about it. The backgrounds are all right, usually being either pictures with oil painting filters on (these look kinda ugly to me, but hey), or 3D modelled backgrounds (some of these are beautiful, especially one of the libraries, although some seem rather more ugly). The music tends towards simplistic, but is by no means bad or dull, and really adds to the whole experience.

There were a couple of moments that nearly made me cry (which is an achievement), and I was glad to see that whilst the answers are there, they're not always given on a silver platter. If you don't consider what you're being shown, you will not understand anything. Chances are you'll be rather confused over timing and reality for a lot of the early game in any event, but try to work it out without getting annoyed by the fact it's not giving you that information.

The character sprites are well made, with all but the most minor of characters having their own model. The sprites not only have a lot of expressions, but a suprisingly wide variety of clothing that actually makes them feel more real.

I only have a couple of gripes about the  game. Firstly, the tips are only accessable from the main menu rather than  having an easy transition from the game, which meant I tended to watch them in bulk later on, making them less relevant to the actual game, and meaning I had to sit through the introduction screen each time I wanted to view them. Secondly, the credits for me bugged out and started flickering like crazy. It took me about 15 hours to complete, which means at full price it's just about value for money (Â£1 for 1 hour), but the hours are excellent, so I would say it's about worth full price.

author: {'steamid': '76561198009272545', 'num_games_owned': 81, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 1789, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1789, 'last_played': 1522929653}
review: If you like yuri or mystery this is a very deep and unique experience that I would recommend to anyone. I have never seen something quite like SeaBed before, this is a story that is emotional in many unexpected ways and that hooked me from the prologue like no other game. The less you know about this visual novel before you start the better.

author: {'steamid': '76561198062669283', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1325, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1176, 'last_played': 1696911759}
review: A heartrending story of love. Amazing read.

author: {'steamid': '76561198084611553', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 1398, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 307, 'last_played': 1585266021}
review:
(While it says I only have 5 hours on record, I played through most of this VN in offline mode, so take that in mind).

Seabed can be a rather confusing and even frustrating experience at first if you go in expecting a traditional narrative structure. The story jumps from one place to another, usually placing its focus on scenes that are mundane by nature: a day at school, an afternoon shopping, maybe a trip or a car drive. In a traditional story, these scenes would be considered "filler", as they don't push the plot forward in any way or offer substantial character development.

It's that same mundanity, however, what makes this VN shine above others. Seabed is more preoccupied with exploring the relationship between Sachiko and Takako and their memories together ("memory" being an important theme all throughout the story) than anything that could be considered "exciting". It's a slow ride, one that takes even its most surprising revelations with an "as a matter-of-factly" tone. It's contemplative, it's quiet, it can even be "boring" under a certain scope, but for these same reasons it's a rather rewarding experience. Don't worry, the plot has its big twists and turns (it's labeled as a mystery for a reason), and there's a lot of romance to go around, avoiding the usual pitfalls of being too edgy/dark or too overwhelmingly optimistic to tell you a story that just kinda *is*.

In other words, Seabed is one of the best JPVNs to reach our shores in recent memory, so definitely give it a go if you're in the need of something special.

author: {'steamid': '76561198031654661', 'num_games_owned': 3513, 'num_reviews': 74, 'playtime_forever': 1140, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1057, 'last_played': 1518705654}
review:
SeaBed is a great yuri/mystery visual novel and I can easily say that it's my favourite visual novel that Fruitbat Factory have localised. I went into it completely blind since I purchased it in a Fruitbat Factory bundle and was surprised to find a world with memorable characters and a great mystery. The game mostly focuses on the two main characters, Sachiko and Takako, and their memory issues. Sachiko has hallucinations of Takako in her everyday life after her sudden disappearance while Takako forgets her memories.

The most interesting part of the game for me is that for most of the game you never see these characters together outside of flashbacks and memories. I was worried about this at first since I thought the game would just end up being all about these memories but they're spaced out pretty well. They're also fun to read because Sachiko and Takako went on a lot of trips together, so there's a lot of different scenery. The game also switches perspectives between these characters every chapter, and they both have their own set of characters. I found all of the side characters to be likable in their own way, and to be honest, they appear so much in the story that they don't even really feel like side characters.

SeaBed also features an excellent presentation. I'm a fan of most of the character designs (the library lady in one scene creeps me out) and they are all very expressive. Sometimes there will be small animations which are nice. There's also a lot of CGs, backgrounds, and sound effects to add to the atmosphere. The soundtrack is also fantastic - it's catchy, the songs fits the scenes they're played in. Sadly the songs seem to be royalty free so I can't buy the soundtrack...

All this being said, I do have a few issues with the game: 
- The translation is pretty good but there are a lot of typos, this may be fixed in the future. 
- The game doesn't tell you which character is talking, this isn't an issue most of the time but sometimes I get confused on who is speaking, especially when a new page of text opens with dialogue.
- There are a few characters that appear for the prologue and only have a short appearance near the end and it was a little sad to never see them again.
- I had a weird crash when I opened the Steam Overlay which forced me to replay from my last save.

All of these issues are minor overall though, and if this review got you interested in the game then I recommend you check it out!

author: {'steamid': '76561198009374496', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1216, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1216, 'last_played': 1518386338}
review:
The best thing I can say about this game is that I was surprised when I saw my 20 hours playtime after finishing. It didn't feel nearly that long, which is a good sign.

The characters and their interactions remain interesting throughout as you proceed through the story.

The story deals with themes of memory, letting go, and moving on. It manages to maintain a hopeful and positive tone, which is nice.

A minor nitpick is that some of the things the characters say come in a giant wall of text if it's just one character saying several things without interruption. I feel this might look a bit better if it were broken down a bit more.

author: {'steamid': '76561198001149625', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 1374, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1250, 'last_played': 1535883880}
review:
SeaBed est une visual novel qui parle de voyages, de souvenirs, de nourriture, de rÃªves et de la sÃ©paration entre deux jeunes femmes (pas forcÃ©ment dans cet ordre). Pour sa version accessible aux gens normaux Fruitbat Factory a fait un bon travail en permettant au lecteur d'augmenter la rÃ©solution jusqu'en 1440*1080 (le futur!) Vous pourrez alors apprÃ©cier des arriÃ¨res plans un peu cheap ainsi que des sprites et des CG plutÃ´t rÃ©ussis malgrÃ© quelques grossiÃ¨res erreurs de proportions. La musique est bien adaptÃ©e, les sons sont au dessus de la moyenne du genre et l'absence de voice acting ne se fait jamais ressentir.

La ou le titre brille, c'est dans sa faÃ§on d'Ãªtre racontÃ©. En changeant rÃ©guliÃ¨rement de point de vue, SeaBed suit le cheminement de trois personnages aux personnalitÃ©s diffÃ©rentes mais au but commun, comprendre ce qui a pu causer la sÃ©paration entre deux d'entre eux et peut Ãªtre rÃ©parer ce lien brisÃ©. Les dialogues font naturels, les descriptions sont nombreuses et tombent justes. D'une maniÃ¨re gÃ©nÃ©rale le texte fourmille de petits dÃ©tails sur l'environnement, la faune et la flore qui rendent les scÃ¨nes intÃ©ressantes et vivantes.

Le rythme est globalement lent, les personnages ne sont pas pressÃ©s ou en danger, il n'y a donc pas vraiment Â«Â d'actionÂ Â» ni de suspens haletant. L'histoire suit tranquillement son cours en donnant de temps Ã  autre des indices, des questions encore sans rÃ©ponses, des passages touchants et quelques moments de lÃ©gÃ¨retÃ©. Les scÃ¨nes importantes se mÃ©langent avec des tranches de vie et si l'on ajoute les Â«Â tipsÂ Â» secondaires dÃ©bloquÃ©s au cours de la lecture, il peut y avoir quelques confusions et besoin de relire. Heureusement le titre est gÃ©nÃ©reusement dÃ©coupÃ© en chapitre et tout est facilement accessible via menu.

Pendant les 20-30h nÃ©cessaires Ã  la lecture, SeaBed fait travailler les mÃ©ninges et rÃ©ussit Ã  maintenir trÃ¨s convenablement le doute quant Ã  un dÃ©nouement que j'ai trouvÃ© logique et satisfaisant.
Si vous aimez le mystÃ¨re, un peu de psychologie, les jolies filles et bien Ã©videmment la nourriture, je ne saurais que vous conseiller d'au moins vous essayer Ã  la dÃ©mo.

Qu'est ce que vous attendez? [i]Â«Â You're planning to sleep in the dream?Â Â»[/i]

author: {'steamid': '76561197963989951', 'num_games_owned': 622, 'num_reviews': 53, 'playtime_forever': 1057, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1057, 'last_played': 1515461365}
review:
I've never read anything like this.

Seabed is a VN that ends up feeling like a dream. It's hard to tell what is real or not because a lot of things don't really make sense, and it's hard to make sense of it even when everything ends. Every chapter has an insane amount of descriptive detail, and the story has a comforting repetition to it. Some segments can be frustratingly longwinded, but at its best it's like wrapping yourself in a warm blanket on a cold morning.

I don't recommend this VN to everyone, but if you can handle not much happening and all of the meticulous detail I would say give it a shot.

author: {'steamid': '76561198105198877', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 85, 'playtime_forever': 1355, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 834, 'last_played': 1514433791}
review: A slow VN to get into but it will make you cry

author: {'steamid': '76561198126597886', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 147, 'playtime_forever': 203, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 203, 'last_played': 1514852298}
review: A all age game developed by Fruitbat Factory. A yuri themed mystery kinetic novel with a good visual and story. The game have not voice acting, but contain a great soundtrack. About game structure, even you set in fullscreen, still will appear two black columns in the sides (at least for me).

author: {'steamid': '76561198024950494', 'num_games_owned': 141, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 874, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 873, 'last_played': 1527218979}
review: It's hard to describe this game without spoiling it.  It's best read when you have no idea what it's about.  It's slow, descriptive, and told in a roundabout way that will have you asking questions the whole way while trying to cling onto some hope for a happy ending that seemingly already failed to come.  It's hardly even a yuri novel if you've read ones in the past, as there's very little falling in love or big arcs characters go through.  Rather, it's about reflecting on the happy past and trying to move on in a world where that happiness is gone.  Very emotional story.

author: {'steamid': '76561198044563176', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 97, 'playtime_forever': 1119, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 914, 'last_played': 1537712987}
review:
While not as riveting as it wants to be nor as emotionally-lasting as it tries to be, there are more good qualities than bad to be found at the bottom of SeaBed's complex labyrinth of perspective and companionship. Fighting off the urge to sleep, a struggle shared by our main protagonists, is a genuine threat for those not fully motivated by a slow-going and intricately-devised narrative structure. Fortunately, the emphasis of its craft supported by a great soundtrack and a wide variety of semi-interesting characters makes for a fulfilling and memorable experience when all is said and done. The only sacrifice made should be one's heightened expectations upon discovery; the answer feels as bittersweet as the debut screen.

+ Great soundtrack
+ Heaps of detail for psychological enthusiasts
+ Foreshadowing 101

- Dry dialogue
- Payoff doesn't match the build-up
- Main couple has little chemistry

Read the full review at https://www.keengamer.com/article/17623_seabed-review

author: {'steamid': '76561198036537305', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 593, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 534, 'last_played': 1514411567}
review:
Seabed is compelling, despite it's flaws. I won't bother going over the synopsys, you can read that in the page description. It's best to go into this game completely blind anyway.

It's romance and slice of life made me happy and sad at the same time, it's mystery kept me guessing and hoping. It's presentation is great in a lot of aspects, good visuals and an amazing OST that I will continue listening to from time to time.

Anyone interested in a compelling and interesting novel that you won't be able to stop reading, please give this game a try.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972507694', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 1822, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1023, 'last_played': 1571133670}
review:
Disclaimer: I'm not at the end yet, will update this review once I finish the story!

I'm having a fantastic time after about 8 hours of gameplay, there's a lot of subtext in every scene to tread through and I'm seeing a lot of foreshadowing for the future that I'm very much excited for. The characters are all fun and interesting (shoutout to bestgirl Narasaki) the music is good, the animation is admittedly low quality but the developers clearly had fun experimenting with '2D stop motion'. If you're looking for a cute story, this is for you. if you're looking for a mystery, this probably is for you too! I'm looking forward to seeing the payoff and reading through this again with more knowledge~

author: {'steamid': '76561198062394411', 'num_games_owned': 176, 'num_reviews': 75, 'playtime_forever': 349, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 326, 'last_played': 1546895084}
review:
SeaBed is a pretty great yuri visual novel, the story is amazing and once you start reading, you can't really stop anymore.
Preordering this was a great idea, and I'll continue to preorder fruitbat titles (if I have the money atleast) till the day they die, wich probs won't happen, right?

On a different note, the emotes and background are AMAZING.
You won't regret crafting the badges, that's for sure!

Make sure to check out this masterpiece! <3

author: {'steamid': '76561198300558746', 'num_games_owned': 384, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 1817, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1817, 'last_played': 1513703555}
review:
[h1] Introduction  [/h1] 
A Yuri-themed kinetic novel told through the perspectives of three separate characters Which took me around 30 hours to finish reading. The game itself is set up like a book with a wall of text that starts from the top then moves down as you read occasionally fading out to show you when a picture in the background has changed facial expressions. 
The story itself can get kinda confusing because not only does it change perspective between three separate characters it also jumps between the past, present and Sachiko's hallucinations. 
As for the changing perspectives you don't have to worry about not knowing who you are. On the side of the screen, there is a conveniently placed nameplate stating whos perspective you are looking through at the moment and changes when you change to a new character.
 
[h1] Story [/h1] 
The Story is very Psychological diving deep inside a character's head and occasionally will go on long explanations about things that will make you question what is real and what is not and not just within the story of the game but within the reality you yourself live in and there were multiple times were I just stopped reading to think about what I just read, Which is were this game really shines and that is in the amazing writing of the story and its character. 
I personally found every character Likable especially the 3 point of view  characters who are:

Sachiko - the person you will be spending the most time as is suffering from hallucinations she sees her childhood friend/lover Takako who for some reason is no longer in her life and she cant remember why.

Takako - Sachiko's childhood friend/lover seems to have a similar condition and has moments were ringing in her ears causes her to lose parts of her memory and she also can't remember why Sachiko is no longer in her life.

Nagasaki is a psychiatrist who wants to help Sachiko out and uncover way she is having hallucinations and it's also her character that delves into the more Psychological explanations that get you thinking.

[h1] Graphics [/h1] 
The backgrounds are filtered photographs while I was not a big fan of them I did like that there were a lot of different ones and I mean a lot from multiple points of view and shown in different times of the day so I never had to stare at the same background for very long. They also had a large variety from Western housing, to Japan, to a town in Italy even the Golden Gate Bridge.
Characters sprites are nice, almost every character has a sprite even if they are only shown for one scene and the main ones have multiple sprites with different poses, facial expressions and outfits. There is also a lot of CG in the gallery. I counted 93 and almost all those pictures have different alternates with different faces or some kind of movement. As for the art style, I found it simple there was nothing completely original about it but it was nice to look at.

[h1] Audio [/h1] 
I really liked the sound effects, which helps you get the feel of what's going on and adds to the atmosphere like water running, stove cooking, eggs breaking, book pages turning. Though none of the music really stood out except for the creepy music box sounding one that only seemed to appear in the tips section called Narasaki's clinic.

[h1] Closing Thoughts [/h1] 
I can say without a doubt I recommend it. Yuri was the main reason I was interested in this game. However, just because I love yuri, doesn't mean that's all I want in a story, and this game did not disappoint me. Yes, there is a yuri love story, but there is so much more too, well-written characters, mystery, and intrigue and psychological wonders.

[code]This review was submitted for [url=store.steampowered.com/curator/25144145/] Gay Gotta Game [/url] [/code]
